_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
January 26th, 2:34 PM
"Yayyyyy hoooo" echoed across the mountain as Sugarbush sliders barreled through the powder in a moment of pure bliss.

We picked up 10 inches of pure goodness overnight, and another 5 inches since lifts opened this morning. Light and fluffy powder is filling every corner of the mountain and inviting you to come surf the Bush today! Temperatures will drop slightly tonight, settling into the lower single digits at the summit and mid to low teens at the base for tomorrow. Expect partly sunny skies with strong winds blowing our wonderful goodness onto the side of trails and into the woods. Snow is still spitting up here and will lightly continue through the night for a bonus few inches. Snowmaking will be firing back up tonight on Downspout, Coffee Run, and Lower Jester, because you can never have too much snow, right? 

Well be getting down on 484 acres, served by 13 lifts and 111 open trails, with 49 trails freshly groomed overnight. Look forward to enjoying mouthwatering groomers topped with fresh snow paired with dreamy, soft powder turns from top to bottom. Slide Brook Express is back in action today, making sure you don't miss a square inch of this powdery playground. Check out Brambles Woods today for pure, mindboggling joy, or bring a snorkel to Moonshine and enjoy a playful swim through the deep stuff. Inverness will be closed tomorrow due to racing events.

Operations are back to weekday hours today. GMX kicks things off with an 8:00 AM load, followed by all other scheduled lifts at 9:00 AM, with the exception of Slide Brook at 10:00 AM. Sugarbush continues to deliver freestyle fun for all levels. At Mt. Ellen, youll find over 80 features on Riemergasse and another 27 features on Sugar Run, all served by the iconic Sunny Quad. At Lincoln Peak, Slowpoke has been refreshed with 10 new features, with more on the way, and 7 creative features remain on Sugarbear Forest. 

Play Blizzard Bingo all month long! As part of NSAA Safety Month, ski, ride, and learn across Sugarbush throughout January. Stop by the Creation Station, located across from Guest Services at Lincoln Peak or Mt. Ellen, to create your safety-themed poster. Todays safety tip: Use Your Words. Fun for all ages, join us this January for an unforgettable Safety Month, and dont forget to check out all of our winter events.

All uphill travel routes are open at both Lincoln Peak and Mt. Ellen. Please review our Uphill Travel Policy for full details.
